results.title: Jimmy the C
results.creator_credit: Jimmy Picker, Jimmy the C Productions and Motionpicker Studios
results.brief_description: Animated film in which a clay Jimmy Carter (using the voice of Ray Charles) evokes the simpler days prior to his Presidency by singing “Georgia on my mind”, flanked by an American flag and backed by a trio of top-hatted peanuts.

results.title: Jimmy Neutron: boy genius
results.creator_credit: Albie Hecht, John A. Davis, Steve Oedekerk, O Entertainment, Nickelodeon Movies and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Computer animated sci-fi story about boy genius Jimmy Neutron who unwittingly causes havoc when a satellite launched by him is picked up by an alien species known as Yokians. These strange green aliens invade Jimmy’s hometown Retroville in the dark of night and abduct all the parents in the town leaving it up to Jimmy, along with his robotic dog, Goddard, his best friend Carl Wheezer and his arch rival Cindy Vortex to take to the skies in a rescue bid to save the parents from becoming human sacrifices. Features the voices of Debi Derryberry, Megan Cavanagh, Mark Decarlo, Martin Short and Patrick Stewart.

results.title: Jiminy Cricket's fabulous fables, fairy tales & other wonderful stories
results.creator_credit: Julie Jenkins, Kevin Riem, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Disney favourite Jiminy Cricket leads the viewer through the history of story telling, starting from Aesop’s fables and continuing through to Hans Christian Anderson and the Brothers Grimm. Stories include; THE TORTOISE AND THE HARE; THE GRASSHOPPER AND THE ANTS; OLD KING COLE; GULLIVER MICKEY; THE BRAVE LITTLE TAILOR; THE PIED PIPER OF HAMELIN; THE UGLY DUCKLING; LITTLE HIAWATHA; ELMER ELEPHANT.

results.title: Jimi Plays Monterey
results.creator_credit: D.A. Pennebaker, Alan Douglas and Pennebaker Associates
results.brief_description: In 1967 America experienced the Monterey International Pop Festival. Acclaimed artists performed for thousands of wild fans. Jimi Hendrix performed at this festival, capturing the audience with incredible music, and Hendrix is shown playing his guitar with his teeth, behind his head, and in other wild ways.

results.title: Jim Jim requeim
results.creator_credit: Ken Newman and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: An animated story depicting the abduction of a young girl’s dog, by the North African Condor, Polly, that her grandparent’s have adopted. Music written and directed by Sue Johnson.

results.title: Jim Henson's the storyteller. Vol. 3
results.creator_credit: Peter Smith, Steve Barron, Jim Henson, Duncan Kenworthy, TVS Films and Jim Henson Productions
results.brief_description: Three folktales narrated by John Hurt featuring live action and characters created by Jim Henson. 1. “Soldier and death” A Russian story of a soldier with a magic sack who captures death and the resulting havoc it causes. 2. “Sapsorrow” A German Cinderella type tale of three sisters. 3. “True bride” A German story of a wicked troll mistreating his orphan servant Anya and a lion with magic gifts who helps her.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Smith, Steve Barron, Jim Henson, Duncan Kenworthy, TVS Films and Jim Henson Productions

results.title: Jim Henson's the storyteller. vol. 2
results.creator_credit: Jim Henson, Paul Weiland, Jon Amiel, Duncan Kenworthy, TVS Films and Jim Henson Productions
results.brief_description: Three folktales narrated by John Hurt featuring live action and characters created by Jim Henson. 1. “The luck child” A Russian story of a seventh son and the power of prophecies. 2. “The three ravens” A German tale of enchantment by a wicked witch turning children into ravens and the spell broken by the king’s daughter being able to keep silent. 3. “Heartless giant” A German tale of a giant with no heart terrorising a country and the king’s son who befriends him and searches for his heart.

results.title: Jim Henson's the storyteller. Vol. 1
results.creator_credit: Charles Sturridge, Steve Barron, Duncan Kenworthy, Mark Shivas, TVS Films and Jim Henson Productions
results.brief_description: Three folktales narrated by John Hurt featuring live action and characters created by Jim Henson. 1. “Hans my hedgehog” A German story about a cursed half-boy, half-hedgehog who can only be freed by loyal love. 2. “A Story Short” A Celtic tale of a storyteller who, if he fails to tell his king a story nightly for a year, will be thrown into a pot of boiling oil. 3. “Fearnot” A German story of a boy who does not know what fear is and attempts to find out.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Sturridge, Steve Barron, Duncan Kenworthy, Mark Shivas, TVS Films and Jim Henson Productions

results.title: Jim Henson's Jack and the beanstalk: the real story
results.brief_description: This modern day retelling of the classic fairytale “Jack and the beanstalk” was originally released as a two-part teleplay and is directed more at a teen/adult audience, rather than for young children. The main characters still feature in the story, young Jack (J.J. Feild), the giant “Thunderdell” (Bill Barretta), the goose that lays the golden eggs, the golden harp, the princess Ondine (Mia Sara). However, that’s just about where the similarities begin and end with the original children’s fairytale version. This is a far more sinister tale focusing on greed, murder and the corporate world of Jack Robinson (Matthew Modine) who has been taught by his ancestors to, “believe in the possibility of the impossible”. Jack’s dream is to build on the family site a “Magic Castle Resort and Casino” but problems of a mysterious kind begin to plague him when a giant human skeleton is found buried on the land and the figure of a woman known as the Matriarch (Vanessa Redgrave), appears from out of nowhere to divulge the secrets of Jack’s ancestors, exposing their sins and a family curse that he can only undo. From here the world of fantasy takes over and it is up to you to believe or not. In the tradition of “Labyrinth”, the Jim Henson Company have made wonderful use of special effects, computer animation, puppet characters and cinemaphotography to create an atmospheric, magical and fantastical retelling of “Jack and the beanstalk”. Cast also includes Daryl Hannah, Jon Voight, Richard Attenborough, and Honor Blackman. Story by James V. Hart and Brian Henson. (Award: Best Single Television Presentation 2002, Academy of Science Fiction, Fantasy and Horror Films)

results.title: Jim and Chang
results.brief_description: This is a send up of every 1970’s cop show made. Jim and Chang are cops. They know kung fu (sort of). Enough said.
